citations.narrative:
The left and right sides of the perimeter fence no longer stand at six feet tall. Upon today’s inspection, the left side
measured 68 inches, and the right side 50.5 inches along its respective fence line instead of the required height of 72
inches. Having a perimeter fence in place protects the animals in the facility by restricting animals and unauthorized
persons from going through it or under it, permitting contact with the animals in the facility. Additionally, it serves as a
secondary containment system for the animals in the facility. The perimeter fence must be of sufficient distance from the
outside of the primary enclosure to prevent physical contact between animals inside the enclosure and animals or
persons outside the perimeter fence. Non-dangerous animals housed in outdoor facilities require a 6-foot-tall perimeter
fence around their enclosure and must be at least 3-feet away from any enclosures or buildings.
Correct by August 18, 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
